intro: Psychotria diguana, commonly known as the "Amazonian Psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found growing in shaded, humid environments within the understory of dense forests. Psychotria diguana is also noted for its role in traditional medicine and its potential ethnobotanical significance.
